meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, the mist recondenses into droplets on the leaves.
meanings.sent2: When you freeze water, it recondenses into ice.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to recondenses the disappearing rabbit, but it ended up as a rubber duck!
meanings.sent4: Her excitement recondenses into nervousness as she steps onto the stage.
meanings.sent5: The morning fog recondenses into dew on the grass, sparkling in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To make more dense or compact.
meanings.sent1: When you press the soil, it recondenses into a solid mass.
meanings.sent2: The chef recondenses the sauce by simmering it for a few more minutes.
meanings.sent3: The students' laughter recondenses into silence as the teacher enters the classroom.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts recondenses into a single focused idea, driving his actions.
meanings.sent5: The artist recondenses the colors on the palette, creating a vibrant masterpiece.
